article.headline: Detroit 62, Youngstown State 47
article.story: DETROIT (AP) -- Brandon Cotton scored 19 and Torvoris Baker had 12 points and 11 rebounds to lead Detroit Mercy past Youngstown State 62-47 Saturday. Quin Humphrey added 10 points in the win that clinched the third seed and a first-round bye in the Horizon League tournament for the Titans (12-5, 9-7). Brian Radakovich had 12 points for the Penguins (5-22, 2-14), who have lost six of their last seven games. Youngstown, the nine-team tournament's bottom seed, visits Loyola on Tuesday for a first-round game. Detroit Mercy will meet the tournament's sixth or seventh seed in a second-round game Friday in Milwaukee. The Titans outscored the Penguins 17-2 during an eight-minute stretch of the first half to take control of the game. Cotton scored 15 points in the half, including the Titans' last nine. Detroit Mercy outrebounded Youngstown 24-10 in the opening half and scored 18 of their 32 points in the paint. Detroit finished the game with a 43-24 advantage on the boards. The Penguins, who scored just 16 points in the first half, trailed by as many as 30 points in the second.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
